definition: inked line/carpenter's straight line marker (an inked cord stretched tight then lowered onto timber)
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
variant of 線|线[xian4]

sentences.english: I apply khaki with green to the impression that contrast with ink lines.
sentences.chinese: 底色采用土黄带绿色和墨线形成对比。

sentences.english: Snap the horizontal cable's tension point with ink line onto the structure façade as the picture shows.
sentences.chinese: 将水平索拉点用墨线弹在结构立面上，如图示。

sentences.english: The dark lines that emerge look like ink lines, and for this reason these are referred to as ink pattern beads.
sentences.chinese: 这些深黑色的线条犹如墨线，所以称为泼墨珠。

sentences.english: A mortice gauge is a special type of marking gauge.
sentences.chinese: 榫锯是一种特殊的墨线戽。

sentences.english: From there we will refine our line work with more confident inked lines.
sentences.chinese: 从那里，我们将完善我们的更有信心墨线线工作。

definition: to make a draft/to draft (a document)
an outline/silhouette
relief shading (in a picture)/fig. to throw into relief
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
to draw/to describe
oblique attack (brush movement in painting)
strokes of a Chinese character
to touch up a painting
strokes of a Chinese character
to wield the pen/to write
carpenter's straight line marker (an inked cord stretched tight then lowered onto timber)
ocher (pigment)
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
technique of writing/calligraphy/or drawing
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
